qas.question: What does the abbreviation IFAB stand for?
What year was the IFAB formed?
How many representatives did FIFA have in the IFAB?
How many different British associations where part of the IFAB?
What does the abbreviation IFAB not stand for?
What year was the IFAB ignored?
How many representatives did FIFA fire in the IFAB?
How many different British associations were not involved with the IFAB?

context: The laws of the game are determined by the <a0_0><b5_0>International Football Association Board<b5_0/><a0_0/> (IFAB). The Board was formed in <a1_0><b6_0>1886<b6_0/><a1_0/> after a meeting in Manchester of The Football Association, the Scottish Football Association, the Football Association of Wales, and the Irish Football Association. FIFA, the international football body, was formed in <a2_0><b7_0>Paris<b7_0/><a2_0/> in 1904 and declared that they would adhere to Laws of the Game of the Football Association. The growing popularity of the international game led to the admittance of FIFA representatives to the International Football Association Board in 1913. The board consists of <a3_0><b8_0>four<b8_0/><a3_0/> representatives from FIFA and one representative from each of the <a4_0><b9_0>four<b9_0/><a4_0/> British associations.
